author: Tiffany Sierra Worley
comment: for the most part i love this widget. its the best one ive used by far. i also love that its slightly customizable. the only things i dont like, and i dont know if this is just my phone or not, but the notifications NEVER go away. no matter how much i dismiss it it just pops right back up immediately. also i dont also have the widget on my lockscreen beside the clock like my last phone. id rather have the widget beside my clock and not as a notification. but other than that i love it

author: Nicki T
comment: I really like the accuracy of this app and the look of it, esp. the "live conditions" look.  But I wish there were more widget sizes and an option to show the weekly forcast on the front of it.  Also, I would rather not have the integrated Google search bar on the widget. I'd give it the last stst if these were included in future updstes. Still, it's the best one I have tried and I bought the ad-free version.

reply.author: OneLouder Apps
reply.content: Hi, the 4x2 tabbed widget has a weekly forecast on it.  The 1Weather Clock (Large) widget is the same widget as the clock and search widget, but without the Google search bar.

author: Tera Reed
comment: Used to be the best app out there! I absolutely love it. Unfortunately, I cannot stop it from having an ongoing notification on my lock screen even after I have shut this function off in the settings. I have a widget, I have the weather in the left hand corner on my phone, and I can click on it anytime I want to get the weather I do not need a notification on my lock screen and on my top bar. When someone stops this in the settings it should stop it. Fix this and it'll get five stars from me!

reply.author: OneLouder Apps
reply.content: Do you have current conditions and ongoing notification both unchecked in Notifications settings?

comment: This app is fun and useful. It doesn't take long to load and is accurate. I love the weather facts. The only thing I would change is when the weather facts pop up, there should be other options to click instead of 'ok.' to exit out of the pop up. Something like 'that's cool' 'good to know' 'i already knew that' etc. To make it more fun. I feel like 'ok' is such an awkward response to awesome weather facts. But the app itself is great!

Magnificent design! Simple UI with clear concise info. Easy to read screens on my Samsung Galaxy. Because I live in between 2 major cities, 60 miles either way, all other weather apps I tried had a 15 min delay between radar updates. Here I get radar updates every 5 min. GREAT WORK GUYS!

author: Brandon Black
comment: Great app design. I have just one issue: Current temp is always accurate but the hourly and high/low forecasts are not accurate. (For example right now it says it's 59 out and the hourly shows 65 and dropping) Not sure where you guys get the data from but it's always off compared to other weather apps (Google, weather channel). Is hourly data not refreshed on demand as well? Maybe that is the issue

Dear 1Weather developers,    1Weather is a great app.  I especially like the design and aesthetic quality of the app and it's widgets.  But, unfortunately, I can only rate this app three stars due to the unreliability of the forecast.  The forecast sometimes seems to be exaggerated; the lows are sometimes too low and the highs are sometimes too high.  I took a screenshot earlier today as proof, but I don't think that there is a way to share that image in this review.  If you will please fix this issue, I will be more than happy to rate this app five stars.  Thank you.

author: Chris Gumbo
comment: Been using this for a couple years. It was great the way it was. New UI design is terrible (not to mention that awful-looking icon). The app functionality is still very good, but aesthetics are important, guys. There's a reason so many of us have used this app for so long. Why'd ya go & slop it up like this?

author: Frustrated Bygoogle
comment: Being somewhat of a 'weather geek' and having tried many others...I think I can unequivocally state that this is by far one of the best weather apps available. Updated 12/15/17...however, I'd like to see more concerning health. Such as ongoing allergen and pain index reports. Thanks devs for a great app.

author: Ashley Ostroske
comment: I love but app but rate it very low because it didn't show the amount of percipitation. It will just say %40 expected in the next hour. Well how many inches is 40%? I want to know how many inches of rain and snow I can expect. I don't have tv so i rely on this app.

author: Doug Stark
comment: My job requires that I know the latest weather conditions. Most apps are too hard to navigate quickly or don't work. This app is great. I checked it out because I noticed the "editor's choice" header when searching for a different weather app. Barring a new update that wrecks it im not looking for anything better because this perfect!

author: Jay Snyder
comment: I got a new phone.  This was preloaded and not removable without going through the process to gain root access.  It's a huge resource waste.  I do not follow weather.  I work inside a climate controlled building.  I do not wish to have this bloatware but haven't taken the time to root my device to be free of it.

author: Seth Snare
comment: I am highly impressed with this app. At first glance it seems like "Oh just another annoying weather app stupid..." But it is soo much more. It does things I have never seen in any other app. It is totally complete and totally satisfying. God I am impressed. Great job you guys!

author: Terrance Chapman
comment: I like the app but the widget doesn't fill my screen horizontally. The 5x1 comes out to be 4x1 and I don't know if it's my phone or the app. I went to the widget settings to try and customize the size but there was not setting. If u can add in the size setting I will give it 5 stars through and through.

author: M Lockhart
comment: This new design I'm very displeased with. Remove 5 star rating to 1. When are you getting rid of the horrible white background? Several updates, still no dark theme

reply.author: OneLouder Apps
reply.content: Hi, we don't have an exact ETA on the dark theme as there are some design elements being finished (it requires a new design for pretty much every screen/menu) but we will get it out there ASAP.

comment: I really like some of the features this app offers, but man the readings are off when it comes to weather. Right now the app says raining but it's snowing! The past few days it said either rain or sunny and it snowed. I'd say it's weather reading is maybe 50% to 80% right. I don't know if it's because of local readings or what.

author: Mike Stamper
comment: Get rid of the stupid Google ads, I have seen the breaking weather ad 19 stinking times in a row. What's up with that? Not recommending his app to anyone. Now it refuses to let you report the retarded add. I DO NOT recommend this app to anyone.

author: Twofish Cipher
comment: The weather icon for current forcast just shows a cloud with a question mark and randomly fixes itself and then reverts back again. Application has full access including 4G. Please investigate!

author: Liz Ard
comment: It's just okay. The controls are clunky, and the radar loop is not very smooth at all. It only shows about 4 or 5 radar pictures that are too far apart in timing. At least the temperature is accurate, and I really do like the graphics. I will try this app later on down the line.

author: Steve Smith
comment: I'm very picky with weather apps. This one strikes a balance between detailed information and minimalism. I get the information I need and no other fluff. You can also get rid of ads for $1.99 not bad considering this is my new go to weather app.

This app came on my phone, at first I wasn't so sure about it. I usually use The Weather Channel app but after giving this app (1Weather) a try, I've actually come to really like it, & I been using it instead of TWC app!!

reply.author: OneLouder Apps
reply.content: We are very glad to hear that you are enjoying the app!  Thanks for letting us know.

author: Mark S
comment: Now that I have used this app for a while, I can say that forecast reliability is not very accurate at all. Precipitation forecasts seem especially bad.  I trust other apps more than this one and I regret purchasing it. More information, such as pollen count, etc., would be beneficial, but I would doubt it's accuracy. It's a nice looking app though.

Interface is ugly. Radar is a joke Perth just went through the worst January rain ON RECORD and the radar showed it all as weak. And what is with the munted choice of radar colour?   Ita Jus practically invisible ffs. Just pick up the Metro's radar and plonk it into this app for heaven's sake!!!

author: Crystal Barkclay
comment: This app is easy to use keeps you well informed. Gives you good updates. Allows some customer preferences to be changed. And give you good information for your area specifically. I'm not talking like a lot of these apps that give you the area like Northwest Iowa. I'm talking about this app giving you the information for the area you're in the town you're in.

author: Lou Natick
comment: I have given this app several chances, have had it with it's inaccuracies. Temps, wind speed, etc usually off by quite a bit from my own instruments AND other apps. Uninstalling for good this time.

author: L.B. BEE
comment: I originally loved this app but lately it seems to be slipping. It seems to be several hours behind showing accurate temperatures and light. For example, just a few days ago it showed that my area was sunny and 67 when it was dark and much cooler. I would like to see up to the minute reporting as they used to have.

author: Jeffry Stolz
comment: Its doing alright. Dont like the theme settings and location settings kept trying to put me in Russia somewhere.  May be deleting it soon.

author: Alan Weinstock
comment: I love this app but the radar had become very unreliable lately and fails to appear. One day it weekend, the next day it fails. Please fix or suggest a solution.

reply.author: OneLouder Apps
reply.content: Hi, you might try the following: https://support.onelouder.com/hc/en-us/articles/115002016943-My-Radar-Map-Won-t-Display-on-Nougat-

comment: I am going to be to the point, I am so grateful to you folks who work so hard to get the weather out to us... Thanks for letting us know what, where, and when, we need to prepare for the great and the not so great weather... Keep doing what you're doing I know I can get it straight, when I look to you're weather,🌪️🌫️🌬️🌀🌈🌂☂️☔⛱️❄️❄️☃️💧🤗

author: Erb Cooper
comment: Not only the most beautiful weather app,  also one of the best designed apps in general. Even the widget is excellent.  Too bad the forecasts aren't quite accurate enough. I use AccuWeather when I need accuracy.

author: Tom Duensing
comment: I like the app overall.  It is fast and the interface is nice.  I've used it in the past but recently bought it and started using it as my main weather app.  One annoying problem is that the temperature values on the "Detail" forecast are usually much different than the temperature values in the other forecasts. They are for the same time/date but the values are different.

Good app but could be better. All the background photos are poor choices for a background. They are all very busy photos that make it hard to read the text and symbols. Had to use the color pallet provided to create a solid sky blue background. Since this is a weather app that should have been a default choice. Also the app stores all those photo backgrounds in my photo gallery. I didn't know it was gonna do that and don't like it. Also it runs in the background when not in use. Should have an option in the menu to turn it off when not in use to conserve battery.  But bad backgrounds choices aside this is a decent app so I give it 4 stars.

author: Samuel Hollister
comment: So this app came pre installed on my phone which I'm not happy about because I feel we should have a choice on what weather app we wanna use and not have one shoved down our throats. I quit using this app years ago because of the way it is first it doesn't even show how much snow or rain we are gonna get in inches which is usually a good thing to know if you are planning a trip anywhere also the radar needs a future forecast added to it so we can see the future on about how long the snow or rain is gonna last by seeing it on the radar and I think they should add some videos to the app as well. But the biggest thing like I mentioned already add how many inches we are gonna get of what its doing outside being snow or rain.

reply.author: OneLouder Apps
reply.content: Depending on the location, some weather stations only update every 30 minutes or every hour.  The radar is a loop up to the current time. So it's possible in some instances that the reporting station hasn't yet updated, but the storm has reached your area.  We still answer all support inquiries from the help menu in the app within 1 business day.

author: Kayla Orellana
comment: I like the layout and its very easy to use. The only thing is say is that I'd like it to update the temp in the corner of my screen without me having to open the app

author: Donald Ziems
comment: Rated this a 4-star weather app in the past, honestly should've given it a 5, as it did everything one could ask for, and looked good doing it. Now, it's been tainted by information overload on every screen: what could once be achieved with a swipe and a glance, now needs clicking and scrolling and drop down menus to accomplish. Major step backwards in user experience.

author: Philip Korkus
comment: Living along the lake in Michigan, the weather is as unpredictable as your mother-in-law. Not now. A great weather app that has spot on short-term forecasts, but long rangers, too.

author: Jonathan Fester
comment: Nice looking app. Woeful in Australia. Radar never shows actual rainfall and forecast consistently inaccurate. Use BOM, it's free too.
Ok so I'm not a weather app expert, but this one seems alright if you just want to know the weather. pretty basic tbh

author: James Lay
comment: I think I should be able to take it off my phone, the temperature is never right. Thee forcasted temperature is wrong.vall in all a bad weather app

author: Ted Churchman
comment: Should be #1. Tried higher rated apps and none compare to this one. You could not get weather w/o 50 ads. This is constantly updated and matches local weather.  Thank you.  Thank you. Thank you.
